shared.facades

Class RobberFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.facades.AbstractFacade
      • shared.facades.RobberFacade

  • public class RobberFacade
extends AbstractFacade
    RobberFacade is a facade for the robber. It checks if players have 8 or more resource cards. It also checks where the robber is being moved and who the player can steal from.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobberFacade(FacadeManager manager)
      Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldDiscardHalf

        public boolean shouldDiscardHalf(Player player)
        If a Player has 8 or more resource cards, they must discard half, rounded down.
        Parameters:
        player - The Player part of the current ClientModel.
        Returns:
        True if the Player has 8 or more resource cards, False if 7 or less.
        Precondition:
        The player must be part of the current ClientModel. The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller.
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • canDiscard

        public boolean canDiscard(ResourceSet resourceDiscard,
                          Player player)
        The method checks if the resourceDiscard are valid cards that can be discarded.
        Parameters:
        resourceDiscard -
        player -
        Returns:
        True if the resourceDiscard has the correct number of cards to discard and the resources in the resourceDiscard are also in the Player.getResources()
        Precondition:
        The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller. The player must be part of the current ClientModel. The resourceDiscard is not null and contains only ResourceType shouldDiscardHalf(Player) returned a true statement for player.
        Postcondition:
        If returns false, sends an error message of the problem If returns true, this method does nothing more

      • discard

        public void discard(@NotNull
                    ResourceSet resourceDiscard,
                    @NotNull
                    Player player)
        The methods discards cards listed in the resourceDiscard from the Player.getResources()
        Parameters:
        resourceDiscard - A ResourceSet of resources meant to be discarded from the player
        player - A Player that is supposed to discard half of their cards
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precondition is violated
        Precondition:
        This method is called by the controller after canDiscard(ResourceSet, Player) returns true
        Postcondition:
        The player removes the resources that are listed in resourceDiscard

      • canMoveRobber

        public boolean canMoveRobber(HexLocation newLocation)
        Checks to see if the new HexLocation is valid for the robber.
        Parameters:
        newLocation - A HexLocation that is the new place for the robber.
        Returns:
        True if newLocation is valid, False if not
        Precondition:
        The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller after every shouldDiscardHalf(Player) for each Player is called. newLocation and currentLocation are not null and are valid HexLocation. This method is called by the controller.
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • moveRobber

        public void moveRobber(@NotNull
                       HexLocation newLocation)
        Moves the robber to the newLocation.
        Parameters:
        newLocation - A HexLocation that is the new place for the robber.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precondition is violated
        Precondition:
        The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller after canMoveRobber(HexLocation) is called. canMoveRobber(HexLocation) returns a true statement.
        Postcondition:
        The robber is moved to the newLocation.

      • canStealFrom

        public boolean canStealFrom(PlayerIndex targetPlayer,
                            PlayerIndex currentPlayer)
        Checks if the current player can be targeted by robbing
        Parameters:
        targetPlayer - the PlayerIndex of the Player to be checked if they can be stolen from
        currentPlayer - the PlayerIndex of the Player that is going to steal
        Returns:
        true if targetPlayer can be stolen from; false if not
        Precondition:
        The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller after moveRobber(HexLocation) is called. The targetPlayer and currentPlayer must not be null and be valid PlayerIndex The targetPlayer must not equal currentPlayer The targetPlayer must have at least one resource
        Postcondition:
        None.

      • steal

        public void steal(@NotNull
                  PlayerIndex targetPlayer,
                  @NotNull
                  PlayerIndex currentPlayer)
        The currentPlayer steals one random resource card from targetPlayer
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - The PlayerIndex of the Player who wants to steal
        targetPlayer - The PlayerIndex of the Player that the currentPlayer wants to take a resource card from
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Precondition:
        The current state of the turn is TurnStatus.ROBBING and this method is called by the controller after canStealFrom(PlayerIndex, PlayerIndex) is called. canStealFrom(PlayerIndex, PlayerIndex) returns a true statement. currentPlayer and targetPlayer are both valid (not null) and are both part of the current ClientModel.
        Postcondition:
        The currentPlayer takes one resource card that originally belonged to the targetPlayer
